When I shared these thoughts with an NFT trader friend, he laughed at me and my naive notion that there is *any* smart money in the market.

Well, what can I say, I'm an optimist. I think there are smart ppl making smart investments into viable projects even in this market.

By this, btw, I don't mean that *everything* is going to zero. At least I don't think so. But I do suspect that we still have some very severe market corrections to come before all the dumb money is flushed out of the market and some semblance of rationality returns.

At the time, I also selfishly wished for one last good pump to unload at least some of my bags. Feels like we got it in January. I hope you too did a bit of risk management in that period, and got out of projects where you could and moved the money into longer term value.

And that that picture would never recover, and instead be replaced by this:
https://t.co/azd3tZwuq2
I called this perhaps a little too early back in November, when I proposed that the current NFT market might look like this: https://t.co/gSJgv65vbQ
We experienced dying bull euphoria back in Jan with all the copycat doodle fren projects pumping for no reason. Now it feels like the most hopeful way to frame this is a dying bear euphoria.

Without people putting in money and getting genuine non-ponzi value out, the NFT market is just a giant redistributive ponzi that's rapidly running out of new Fools. Rn any rational investor or customer is staying away from this absolute utter nonsense.

Yes, this, folks, is the face of the NFT market at this moment. Gaze upon it, fill yourself up with an appropriate sense of dread.

Cause let's face it, as @cobie put it in a tentative rename of his UpOnly podcast, it's going to zero, all of it. https://t.co/dYKxoJ51Lb

Meanwhile - war continues in Ukraine, Russia's economy is going down the toilet, crypto is pumping (which might partly explain the low volumes), gas is super duper low.

Oh, and Kevins, the dumpster fires of NFTs, are selling for 8.88 eth. https://t.co/Fz8AI44OCl

The women-led projects index is only not making new all time lows because it's been making them every day for weeks and it's taking a well deserved breather before carrying on, afaict. https://t.co/y5Mg0SgCbC

Zeneca New (whose project makeup is not all that new anymore, tbf) is not quite making new lows, but it's pretty close and only a matter of time. And we're quibbling about pennies here. It's low af. https://t.co/Z9xWRpns2C

Just how low are we talking? Well, looking at the stacked bar charts 45d report... The last 6 hours has seen the lowest amount of sales in 45 days.

So all those older projects are suffering along with the top ten. https://t.co/SMSFRnHKzF
Before I go off on a rant, let's look at the other indices.  Zeneca Old has also collapsed into a clear all time low. https://t.co/yOCFoAXl0C

Who would buy a floor ape for 88 eth in this market? Or a floor MAYC for almost 18 eth?

The answer is in the data: basically no one. Yell at me if you want, but that's the reality. You may think your bored ape has an 88 eth floor but if no one is buying, does it?

I think not.

The market health index has duly responded by forming a new all time low.

Can we go lower? Yes ser, we sure can, we could have volumes entirely drop off. If no one lowers their prices, that is, imho, what will happen. https://t.co/vG5sUVXZRH

Right so... yeah. I mean, so much for that hope that the volumes would flatten or start going up again. This time we didn't even manage three higher bars... The top ten projects made about 10 sales total in the last 6 hours. Across all ten projects. https://t.co/wXbbluNQRZ

If you can't get enough of this stuff, have a look at https://t.co/tuySNnEcMB and get the straight facts about the market in your inbox, your youtube, everywhere - try all three if you want to really get cynical... I mean, realistic... ;-)
